section_path: Section I > C. Chapter-Specific Coding Guidelines > 20. Chapter 20: External Causes of Morbidity > j. Terrorism Guidelines > 3) Code Y38.9, Terrorism, secondary effects

content.full_text: Assign code Y38.9, Terrorism, secondary effects, for conditions occurring subsequent to the terrorist event. This code should not be assigned for conditions that are due to the initial terrorist act. It is acceptable to assign code Y38.9 with another code from Y38 if there is an injury due to the initial terrorist event and an injury that is a subsequent result of the terrorist event. (Evidence: pg no: 92, L49-L51)
content.summary: Guidelines for using Y38.9 for secondary effects of terrorism, distinct from initial terrorist act injuries (Evidence: pg no: 92, L49-L51)
key_concepts: Y38.9 for conditions subsequent to terrorist event (Evidence: pg no: 92, L49-L50)
Not for initial terrorist act conditions (Evidence: pg no: 92, L50)
Can be used with other Y38 codes (Evidence: pg no: 92, L50-L51)
Distinction between initial and subsequent effects (Evidence: pg no: 92, L49-L51)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Use Y38.9 for conditions occurring subsequent to terrorist event (Evidence: pg no: 92, L49-L50)
detailed_rules.explanation: Code Y38.9 is specifically for conditions that develop after the initial terrorist event, not for injuries directly caused by the initial act (Evidence: pg no: 92, L49-L50)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Do not use Y38.9 for conditions due to initial terrorist act (Evidence: pg no: 92, L50)
detailed_rules.explanation: Y38.9 should not be assigned for conditions that are directly caused by the initial terrorist act itself (Evidence: pg no: 92, L50)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Y38.9 can be used with other Y38 codes when both initial and subsequent effects present (Evidence: pg no: 92, L50-L51)
detailed_rules.explanation: It is acceptable to assign both Y38.9 and another Y38 code when a patient has both injuries from the initial terrorist event and subsequent effects (Evidence: pg no: 92, L50-L51)
common_applications: Patients with both direct and secondary effects

workflow_steps: Step 1: Identify if condition is from initial terrorist act or subsequent
Step 3: If initial act, use appropriate specific Y38 code
Step 4: Use both if patient has both types of effects

usage_rules: Can be combined with Y38.9 when appropriate (Evidence: pg no: 92, L50-L51)

specific_codes.description: Terrorism, secondary effects (Evidence: pg no: 92, L49)
specific_codes.context: For conditions subsequent to terrorist event

coding_scenarios.scenario: Patient develops PTSD months after surviving terrorist attack
coding_scenarios.documentation_example: Post-traumatic stress disorder, secondary effect of terrorist attack 6 months ago
step_by_step: Step 1: Identify condition as secondary effect of terrorism
Step 3: Assign Y38.9 for terrorism secondary effects
Step 4: Do not use other Y38 codes for this condition

correct_coding.sequencing: Condition first, then secondary effects code
correct_coding.rationale: Condition occurred subsequent to terrorist event (Evidence: pg no: 92, L49-L50)

incorrect_coding.code: Specific Y38 code for initial terrorist act
incorrect_coding.rationale: Should use Y38.9 for secondary effects, not initial act codes
incorrect_coding.common_mistake: Using wrong Y38 code for timing of condition

coding_scenarios.scenario: Patient has both direct injuries from terrorist attack and later develops secondary conditions
coding_scenarios.documentation_example: Fractures from terrorist bombing (initial) and PTSD developed later (secondary)
step_by_step: Step 1: Identify both initial and secondary effects
Step 2: Code fractures with specific Y38 code
Step 4: Use both Y38 codes as appropriate

correct_coding.sequencing: Conditions first, then appropriate Y38 codes
correct_coding.rationale: Acceptable to use Y38.9 with other Y38 codes when both types present (Evidence: pg no: 92, L50-L51)

incorrect_coding.code: Only Y38.9 for all terrorism-related conditions
incorrect_coding.rationale: Should use specific codes for initial act injuries
incorrect_coding.common_mistake: Using only secondary effects code for all conditions

warnings: Do not use Y38.9 for conditions due to initial terrorist act (Evidence: pg no: 92, L50)
best_practices: Distinguish between initial and subsequent effects of terrorism (Evidence: pg no: 92, L49-L51)
Use Y38.9 only for conditions occurring after the terrorist event (Evidence: pg no: 92, L49-L50)
common_mistakes: Using Y38.9 for direct injuries from terrorist attack (Evidence: pg no: 92, L50)
tips: Can combine Y38.9 with other Y38 codes when both types of effects present (Evidence: pg no: 92, L50-L51)
